poem:
### The Meeting

In the white hall of power,  
two men cast shadows,  
their voices low as tides  
on distant, troubled shores.  
Gaza flickers in their eyes,  
a map of sorrow etched  
by hands that shake  
not from fear, but from  
the weight of nations  
hungering for peace.
